definition[0]: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have done, or to be polite about it
example[0]: I haven’t had a chance to thank him yet.
example[1]: Did you thank Uncle Ron for the present?
definition[1]: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have given you or done for you
example[3]: She thanked them for the presents.
example[4]: You don’t need to thank me.
example[5]: He thanked her for coming and showed her to her car.
definition[2]: to thank someone by saying the words ‘thank you’, or by giving them something
example[6]: I just wanted to say thank you for all your help.
example[7]: This gift is our way of saying thank you to everyone who worked so hard.
example[8]: Make sure you say thank you for your birthday presents.
definition[3]: to thank someone for something they have done – used in speeches and letters
example[9]: I would like to express my gratitude to all those who have sent me letters of support.
definition[4]: to thank someone by giving them something, or by doing something special for them
example[10]: To show our gratitude for all your hard work, we are paying you a special bonus.
definition[5]: to publicly do or say something to thank someone for their help or support
example[11]: The building will be named the John Laird Centre, to acknowledge the contribution of the Laird family to the area.
example[12]: He acknowledged the applause with a small bow.
